The training rule on with food in the mouth

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sakabaḷena mukhena byāharanti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū sa kabaḷena mukhena byāharanti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six were speaking with food in their mouths. …

analyzed: na sa kabaḷena mukhena byāharissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not speak with food in my mouth,’ this is how you should train.”
One should not speak with food in one’s mouth.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca sakabaḷena mukhena byāharati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca sa kabaḷena mukhena byāharati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, speaks with food in his mouth, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
if it is unintentional, if he is the first offender,
or if he is insane.🔽The third training rule is finished.
